t: Psalm 59
The Assured Judgment of the Wicked
To the Chief Musician. Set to “Do Not Destroy.” A Michtam of David when Saul sent men, and they watched the house in order to kill him.
Deliver*pn me from my enemies, O my God; Defend*ld me from those who rise up against me.
Deliver*ld me from the workers of iniquity, And*ld save me from bloodthirsty men.
For*ln look, they lie in wait for my life; The*ld mighty gather against me, Not*ld for*i my transgression nor for*i my sin, O Lord.*s
They*ld run and prepare themselves through no fault of*i mine.*i Awake*ln to help me, and behold!
You*ld therefore, O Lord*s God of hosts, the God of Israel, Awake*ld to punish all the nations; Do*ld not be merciful to any wicked transgressors. Selah*ipg
At*pn evening they return, They*ld growl like a dog, And*ld go all around the city.
Indeed,*ld they belch with their mouth; Swords*ld are*i in their lips; For*ld they*i say,*i “Who hears?”
But*ln You, O Lord,*s shall laugh at them; You*ld shall have all the nations in derision.
I*ld will wait for You, O You his Strength; For*ld God is*i my defense.
My*ld God of mercy shall come to meet me; God*ld shall let me see my*i desire*i on my enemies.
Do*ln not slay them, lest my people forget; Scatter*ld them by Your power, And*ld bring them down, O*ld Lord our shield.
For*ild the sin of their mouth and*i the words of their lips, Let*ld them even be taken in their pride, And*ld for the cursing and lying which*i they speak.
Consume*ld them*i in wrath, consume them,*i That*ld they may*i not be;*i And*ld let them know that God rules in Jacob To*ld the ends of the earth. Selah*ipg
And*pn at evening they return, They*ld growl like a dog, And*ld go all around the city.
They*ld wander up and down for food, And*ld howl if they are not satisfied.
But*ln I will sing of Your power; Yes,*ld I will sing aloud of Your mercy in the morning; For*ld You have been my defense And*ld refuge in the day of my trouble.
To*ld You, O my Strength, I will sing praises; For*ld God is*i my defense, My*ld God of mercy.
